conclusion: Need to find forces F1 and F2 acting on rings E and F.
Two fixed rods OA (vertical) and OB (45 degrees to OA) with rings E and F.
Mass m is suspended by a non-extensible light rope at point D.
System is in equilibrium; forces and torques are balanced.
Need to draw a free-body diagram to visualize forces.
Forces on mass m: weight mg downward, tension in rope.
Tension is the same throughout the rope.
Ring E on vertical rod OA, Ring F on rod OB at 45 degrees.
Forces on ring E: normal force F1, tension from rope.
Forces on ring F: normal force F2, tension from rope.
Rings are in equilibrium; forces must balance.
Find expressions for F1 and F2.
Ring E on vertical rod OA, tension acts horizontally.
Need to confirm directions of forces.
Angle between OA and OB is 45 degrees.
Assume OA is along y-axis, OB at 45 degrees to OA.
OB is at 45 degrees from vertical.
Forces at ring E: tension along rope, normal force horizontal.
Forces at ring F: tension along rope, normal force at 135 degrees.
Normal force on OB is at 135 degrees from vertical.
Normal force on OA is horizontal.
System is in equilibrium; forces must balance.
Find tensions in terms of F1 and F2.
At ring E: tension T along rope, normal force F1 horizontal.
At ring F: tension T along rope, normal force F2 at 135 degrees.
